meanings.definition: The beginning or start of something.
meanings.sent1: At the outset of the race, all the runners lined up at the starting line.
meanings.sent2: The project faced challenges right from the outset.
meanings.sent3: The cake mix spilled at the outset, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm at the outset was like a spark igniting a fire.
meanings.sent5: The excitement at the outset was palpable, setting the tone for the event.

meanings.definition: The point at which something starts.
meanings.sent1: From the outset of the movie, the audience was captivated by the storyline.
meanings.sent2: The team's strategy was clear from the outset of the game.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics at the outset of the party brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise at the outset of the day painted the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The tension at the outset of the negotiation was thick, hinting at the challenges ahead.
